intro: Anemone narcissiflora var. parviflora, commonly known as the dwarf anemone, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of 6 to 12 inches, making it well-suited for rock gardens or as a border plant. It prefers full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, thriving in USDA hardiness zones 4 through 8. Its delicate foliage and early spring bloom make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens.
